Documentation des constructeurs et destructeur
__construct() __constructImap Imap__construct
__construct ( $params)
create instance with parameters
Supported parameters are
user username
host hostname or ip address of IMAP server [optional, default = 'localhost']
password password for user 'username' [optional, default = '']
port port for IMAP server [optional, default = 110]
ssl 'SSL' or 'TLS' for secure sockets
folder select this folder [optional, default = 'INBOX']
Paramètres
array | object | Protocol\Imap$params
mail reader specific parameters or configured Imap protocol object
Exceptions
Exception
RuntimeException
Exceptions
Exception
InvalidArgumentException
Exceptions
Protocol
Exception\RuntimeException
Réimplémentée à partir de AbstractStorage. Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Documentation des fonctions membres
appendMessage() appendMessageImap ImapappendMessage
appendMessage ( $message, $folder = null , $flags = null )
append a new message to mail storage
Paramètres
string$message
message as string or instance of message class
null | string | Folder$folder
folder for new message, else current folder is taken
null | array$flags
set flags for new message, else a default set is used
Exceptions
Exception
RuntimeException
Implémente WritableInterface.
close() closeImap Imapclose
close ( )
Close resource for mail lib.
If you need to control, when the resource is closed. Otherwise the destructor would call this.

createFolder() createFolderImap ImapcreateFolder
createFolder ( $name, $parentFolder = null )
create a new folder
This method also creates parent folders if necessary. Some mail storages may restrict, which folder may be used as parent or which chars may be used in the folder name
Paramètres
string$name
global name of folder, local name if $parentFolder is set
string | Folder$parentFolder
parent folder for new folder, else root folder is parent
Exceptions
Exception
RuntimeException
Implémente WritableInterface.

getNumberByUniqueId() getNumberByUniqueIdImap ImapgetNumberByUniqueId
getNumberByUniqueId ( $id)
get a message number from a unique id
I.e. if you have a webmailer that supports deleting messages you should use unique ids as parameter and use this method to translate it to message number right before calling removeMessage()
Paramètres
string$id
unique id
Exceptions
Exception
InvalidArgumentException Renvoie
int message number
Réimplémentée à partir de AbstractStorage. Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :

getUniqueId() getUniqueIdImap ImapgetUniqueId
getUniqueId ( $id = null )
get unique id for one or all messages
if storage does not support unique ids it's the same as the message number.
Paramètres
int | null$id
message number
Renvoie
array|string message number for given message or all messages as array

Protocol

moveMessage() moveMessageImap ImapmoveMessage

$knownFlags[static], [protected]Valeur initiale := [ '\Passed' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_PASSED, '\Answered' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_ANSWERED, '\Seen' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_SEEN, '\Unseen' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_UNSEEN, '\Deleted' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_DELETED, '\Draft' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_DRAFT, '\Flagged' => Mail\Storage::FLAG_FLAGGED, ]
$protocol $protocolImap Imap$protocol
$protocol[protected]
$searchFlags $searchFlagsImap Imap$searchFlags
$searchFlags[static], [protected]Valeur initiale := [ '\Recent' => 'RECENT', '\Answered' => 'ANSWERED', '\Seen' => 'SEEN', '\Unseen' => 'UNSEEN', '\Deleted' => 'DELETED', '\Draft' => 'DRAFT', '\Flagged' => 'FLAGGED', ]
La documentation de cette classe a été générée à partir du fichier suivant : public/glpi/vendor/laminas/laminas-mail/src/Storage/Imap.php
